Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2017 06:53AM lily2 wrote: Hello djmammo, I am fairly new to this site.I see that you are a radiologist.I have a question and wanted your opinion if possible. I am currently doing the rapidarc treatment because I was told that the standard radiation wold be to difficult to do in with my situation.My question..is this form of treament typically used for breast cancer? Thanks
Posts.Title: How often is scar tissue with no prior surgery just scar tissue? Coley99 ksusan

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2017 09:03AM - edited Sep 27, 2017 09:53AM by lily2 Thanks mom of twins!! I can tell you I really wasn't expecting a pcr.I don't think my MO expected a pcr due to the extent of cancer in my breast and lymph nodes,my original plan was a radical mastectomy with full axillary removal, but ended up having a quadrantectomy with 2 sentinal nodes removed.I'm still in disbelief and think they missed something on pathology but I need to get over it and think positive with having such good results.lol
Posts.Title: Response to neoadjuvant chemo? Mom_of_twins beauz

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2017 09:34PM lily2 wrote: Hello everyone, although I am not er+ I had a complete responce to neoadjuvant chemotherapy .I was told that I had axillary and internal mammory nodes involved from petscan but none were ever biopsied. They did however show up clear on the breast mri I had after my 5th treatment.it also showed residual cancer in my breast but final pathology showed no cancer just benign calcifications and inflammation with a big scar from the initial biopsy 5 months prior.
Posts.Title: Response to neoadjuvant chemo? Mom_of_twins beauz
Would you mind sharing your age at time of diagnosis? ByFaith Gussy
